TextBody:
Hi Javier,

1.I would advise the customer to check our manual, located here-
https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_5_User_Manual_EN.pdf
page 82/299 chapter 6.3.2.3 on CLipboard functionality. For instance, the Source code option monitored the COpy and Paste operations.That should answer their question.
2. We monitoring the upload of files, so data egress(leaving the network).I am not sure at what stag this is occurring during the synchronization/when it takes place.If this is during the data egress/upload, then yes, the policy should apply on the selected exit points.Files, depending on how the policy was setup are inspected as file type-if selected in the CAP policy, or/and it insepects the data it contains. If more info is needed on this second topic, I would like some screenshots, just to see how their policy was set up.

Best Regards,

Adrian Stanca
ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BNgRj:ref
Subject: URGENT Support case for Prospect LiNear  (POC)    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BNgRj:ref ]

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BNgRj:ref

Good Morning,


  1.  In the attachments is our CopyPastePolicy
We configured the policy, so we can copy and paste in visual studio but not in a web browser.
This works fine.
The only issue we have is the Block notification we get by every Copy action. Even when its not blocked.



  1.  When Nextcloud sees a new File and Uploads it. The Policy works fine.
The problem comes when a new file is not blocked and Nextcloud uploads this.
After the Upload we can change the file and put sourcecode in it. ( a simple .txt)
The next time Nextcloud synchronise the file it is not blocked and the modified version with sourcecode has left the network.


Freundliche Grüße
Andre Tinnemann

Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #410794 - ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BNgRj:ref - AW: URGENT Support case for Prospect LiNear  (POC)    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BNgRj:ref ]

TextBody:
Hi Andre,

Thank you for your email.
1.So if I understand this correctly, the notification saying the element is blocked shows up
and it should not?
I would check the Reports and Analysis Section- Content Aware reports- and see the triggered element.
Also, if the pop ups are annoying, you can simply disable them


2.I understand, I think the issue.So it applies the policy only for the first time of that file, but then if the file is changed/edited
the policy is not applying anymore? I am not sure exactly how Nextcloud is operating.Is encryption involved? Also is it inspecting the headers?
For instance, our DPI setting if active, it enables a proxy server, which scans for content. Now if other solutions, like other proxies,antivirus, firewalls, etc are scanning the 
traffic too, our DPI setting no longer scans it, so a quick question here. Is the DPI active?Do they use proxies, firewalls, etc, anything that could scan traffic?
If they do, and DPI was active, they might want to enable Stealthy DPI option from Global settings.

Adrian Stanca
Technical Support Engineer

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | Enforced Encryption | eDiscovery
Email | Website | LinkedIn

1.      Thats right.
As an attachment is our Log for this instance.
We know that we can deactivate all pop ups. But in other instances it is nice to have.



  1.  This is right.

DPI is not active

Our Nextcloud  has no Encryption active

I tried with deactivated AV program so there should not be a program wo intervenes.
As far as I know, Nextcloud looks at the Date for modification. If this is different it syncs.

Freundliche Grüße
Andre Tinnemann

Hi Andre,
Thank you for your email.

As far as I can tell, most likely logs will need to be collected, and a case will need to be raised internally, if I will be unable to figure out the issue/behaviour.

Also, if a German speaker will be required, I can inquire internally about this, and another engineer will assist them as I don't speak Deutsch.

Adrian Stanca

Hi Andre,

Thank you for your email.
1.So if I understand this correctly, the notification saying the element is blocked shows up
and it should not?
I would check the Reports and Analysis Section- Content Aware reports- and see the triggered element.
Also, if the pop ups are annoying, you can simply disable them


2.I understand, I think the issue.So it applies the policy only for the first time of that file, but then if the file is changed/edited
the policy is not applying anymore? I am not sure exactly how Nextcloud is operating.Is encryption involved? Also is it inspecting the headers?
For instance, our DPI setting if active, it enables a proxy server, which scans for content. Now if other solutions, like other proxies,antivirus, firewalls, etc are scanning the 
traffic too, our DPI setting no longer scans it, so a quick question here. Is the DPI active?Do they use proxies, firewalls, etc, anything that could scan traffic?
If they do, and DPI was active, they might want to enable Stealthy DPI option from Global settings.

Adrian Stanca
Technical Support Engineer

Good Morning,

 


	In the attachments is our CopyPastePolicy


We configured the policy, so we can copy and paste in visual studio but not in a web browser.

This works fine.

The only issue we have is the Block notification we get by every Copy action. Even when its not blocked.

 

 


	When Nextcloud sees a new File and Uploads it. The Policy works fine.


The problem comes when a new file is not blocked and Nextcloud uploads this.

After the Upload we can change the file and put sourcecode in it. ( a simple .txt)

The next time Nextcloud synchronise the file it is not blocked and the modified version with sourcecode has left the network.

 

 



	
		
			
			Freundliche Grüße

the policy is not applying anymore? I am not sure exactly how Nextcloud is operating.Is encryption involved? Also is it inspecting the headers?
For instance, our DPI setting if active, it enables a proxy server, which scans for content. Now if other solutions, like other proxies,antivirus, firewalls, etc are scanning the 
traffic too, our DPI setting no longer scans it, so a quick question here. Is the DPI active?Do they use proxies, firewalls, etc, anything that could scan traffic?
If they do, and DPI was active, they might want to enable Stealthy DPI option from Global settings.

Adrian Stanca

Hi Andre,

Thank you for your email.
1.So <https://1.So>  if I understand this correctly, the notification saying the element is blocked shows up and it should not?
I would check the Reports and Analysis Section- Content Aware reports- and see the triggered element.
Also, if the pop ups are annoying, you can simply disable them


2.I understand, I think the issue.So <https://issue.So>  it applies the policy only for the first time of that file, but then if the file is changed/edited the policy is not applying anymore? I am not sure exactly how Nextcloud is operating.Is <https://operating.Is>  encryption involved? Also is it inspecting the headers?
For instance, our DPI setting if active, it enables a proxy server, which scans for content. Now if other solutions, like other proxies,antivirus, firewalls, etc are scanning the traffic too, our DPI setting no longer scans it, so a quick question here. Is the DPI active?Do they use proxies, firewalls, etc, anything that could scan traffic?
If they do, and DPI was active, they might want to enable Stealthy DPI option from Global settings.

Adrian Stanca

Good Morning,



1. In the attachments is our CopyPastePolicy

We configured the policy, so we can copy and paste in visual studio but not in a web browser.

This works fine.

The only issue we have is the Block notification we get by every Copy action. Even when its not blocked.





2. When Nextcloud sees a new File and Uploads it. The Policy works fine.

The problem comes when a new file is not blocked and Nextcloud uploads this.

After the Upload we can change the file and put sourcecode in it. ( a simple .txt)

The next time Nextcloud synchronise the file it is not blocked and the modified version with sourcecode has left the network.

I would check the Reports and Analysis Section- Content Aware reports- and see the triggered element.
Also, if the pop ups are annoying, you can simply disable them


2.I understand, I think the issue.So <https://issue.So> it applies the policy only for the first time of that file, but then if the file is changed/edited the policy is not applying anymore? I am not sure exactly how Nextcloud is operating.Is <https://operating.Is> encryption involved? Also is it inspecting the headers?
For instance, our DPI setting if active, it enables a proxy server, which scans for content. Now if other solutions, like other proxies,antivirus, firewalls, etc are scanning the traffic too, our DPI setting no longer scans it, so a quick question here. Is the DPI active?Do they use proxies, firewalls, etc, anything that could scan traffic?
If they do, and DPI was active, they might want to enable Stealthy DPI option from Global settings.

Adrian Stanca
Technical Support Engineer

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | Enforced Encryption | eDiscovery Email | Website | LinkedIn

Good Morning,



1. In the attachments is our CopyPastePolicy

We configured the policy, so we can copy and paste in visual studio but not in a web browser.

This works fine.

The only issue we have is the Block notification we get by every Copy action. Even when its not blocked.





2. When Nextcloud sees a new File and Uploads it. The Policy works fine.

The problem comes when a new file is not blocked and Nextcloud uploads this.

After the Upload we can change the file and put sourcecode in it. ( a simple .txt)

The next time Nextcloud synchronise the file it is not blocked and the modified version with sourcecode has left the network.

Hi Andre,

Thank you for your email.
1.So<https://1.So> <https://1.So> if I understand this correctly, the notification saying the element is blocked shows up and it should not?
I would check the Reports and Analysis Section- Content Aware reports- and see the triggered element.
Also, if the pop ups are annoying, you can simply disable them


2.I understand, I think the issue.So<https://issue.So> <https://issue.So> it applies the policy only for the first time of that file, but then if the file is changed/edited the policy is not applying anymore? I am not sure exactly how Nextcloud is operating.Is<https://operating.Is> <https://operating.Is> encryption involved? Also is it inspecting the headers?
For instance, our DPI setting if active, it enables a proxy server, which scans for content. Now if other solutions, like other proxies,antivirus, firewalls, etc are scanning the traffic too, our DPI setting no longer scans it, so a quick question here. Is the DPI active?Do they use proxies, firewalls, etc, anything that could scan traffic?
If they do, and DPI was active, they might want to enable Stealthy DPI option from Global settings.

1. In the attachments is our CopyPastePolicy

We configured the policy, so we can copy and paste in visual studio but not in a web browser.

This works fine.

The only issue we have is the Block notification we get by every Copy action. Even when its not blocked.





2. When Nextcloud sees a new File and Uploads it. The Policy works fine.

The problem comes when a new file is not blocked and Nextcloud uploads this.

After the Upload we can change the file and put sourcecode in it. ( a simple .txt)

The next time Nextcloud synchronise the file it is not blocked and the modified version with sourcecode has left the network.

page 82/299 chapter 6.3.2.3 on CLipboard functionality. For instance, the Source code option monitored the COpy and Paste operations.That should answer their question.
2. We monitoring the upload of files, so data egress(leaving the network).I am not sure at what stag this is occurring during the synchronization/when it takes place.If this is during the data egress/upload, then yes, the policy should apply on the selected exit points.Files, depending on how the policy was setup are inspected as file type-if selected in the CAP policy, or/and it insepects the data it contains. Subject: AW: AW: AW: AW: AW: AW: Netwrix Support Ticket #410794 -  - AW: URGENT Support case for Prospect LiNear  (POC)    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BNgRj:ref ]

TextBody:
Hi Andre,

Thank you for your email.
1.I have 1 more idea if you don't mind.Let us try and switch DPI to active from Device Control- Global Settings-
 Save the settings.
2.Lets try to create a Denylist for the IP of the server, where you are trying  to send over the data via Nextcloud
After this was created- go to Content Aware protection tab,Content Aware Policies, edit a policy- and from the Policy Denylist subcategory- select the Domain and URL- and enable the newly created denylist for the IP of the network.
Is uploading data top the blacklisted network being denied now?

I understand. As far as I've heard- since we recently migrated to new ticketing system,I will leave below the guide.

Effective May 3rd, 2024, opening NEW tickets by e-mail is no longer possible.Please use our Support Portal to submit a case.If you’re not already signed up, you can create an account at the following link and access the portal:  https://www.netwrix.com/sign_in.html.Please refer to our Support Reference Guide for details on support process including available contact methods, SLAs, and case severity guidelines.Best Regards,
CoSoSys Product Support Team

1.So <https://1.So> if I understand this correctly, the notification saying the element is blocked shows up and it should not?
I would check the Reports and Analysis Section- Content Aware reports- and see the triggered element.
Also, if the pop ups are annoying, you can simply disable them


2.I understand, I think the issue.So <https://issue.So> it applies the policy only for the first time of that file, but then if the file is changed/edited the policy is not applying anymore? I am not sure exactly how Nextcloud is operating.Is <https://operating.Is> encryption involved? Also is it inspecting the headers?
For instance, our DPI setting if active, it enables a proxy server, which scans for content. Now if other solutions, like other proxies,antivirus, firewalls, etc are scanning the traffic too, our DPI setting no longer scans it, so a quick question here. Is the DPI active?Do they use proxies, firewalls, etc, anything that could scan traffic?
If they do, and DPI was active, they might want to enable Stealthy DPI option from Global settings.

Hi Andre,

Thank you for your email.
1.I have 1 more idea if you don't mind.Let us try and switch DPI to active from Device Control- Global Settings-
 Save the settings.
2.Lets try to create a Denylist for the IP of the server, where you are trying  to send over the data via Nextcloud
After this was created- go to Content Aware protection tab,Content Aware Policies, edit a policy- and from the Policy Denylist subcategory- select the Domain and URL- and enable the newly created denylist for the IP of the network.
Is uploading data top the blacklisted network being denied now?

Hi Andre,

Thank you for your email.
1.So  <https://1.So> if I understand this correctly, the notification saying the element is blocked shows up and it should not?
I would check the Reports and Analysis Section- Content Aware reports- and see the triggered element.
Also, if the pop ups are annoying, you can simply disable them


2.I understand, I think the issue.So <https://issue.So> it applies the policy only for the first time of that file, but then if the file is changed/edited the policy is not applying anymore? I am not sure exactly how Nextcloud is operating.Is <https://operating.Is> encryption involved? Also is it inspecting the headers?
For instance, our DPI setting if active, it enables a proxy server, which scans for content. Now if other solutions, like other proxies,antivirus, firewalls, etc are scanning the traffic too, our DPI setting no longer scans it, so a quick question here. Is the DPI active?Do they use proxies, firewalls, etc, anything that could scan traffic?
If they do, and DPI was active, they might want to enable Stealthy DPI option from Global settings.

Also, if the pop ups are annoying, you can simply disable them


2.I understand, I think the issue.So<https://issue.So> <https://issue.So> it applies the policy only for the first time of that file, but then if the file is changed/edited the policy is not applying anymore? I am not sure exactly how Nextcloud is operating.Is<https://operating.Is> <https://operating.Is> encryption involved? Also is it inspecting the headers?
For instance, our DPI setting if active, it enables a proxy server, which scans for content. Now if other solutions, like other proxies,antivirus, firewalls, etc are scanning the traffic too, our DPI setting no longer scans it, so a quick question here. Is the DPI active?Do they use proxies, firewalls, etc, anything that could scan traffic?
If they do, and DPI was active, they might want to enable Stealthy DPI option from Global settings.

Hi Andre,

Thank you for your email.
1.I have 1 more idea if you don't mind.Let us try and switch DPI to active from Device Control- Global Settings-
 Save the settings.
2.Lets try to create a Denylist for the IP of the server, where you are trying  to send over the data via Nextcloud
After this was created- go to Content Aware protection tab,Content Aware Policies, edit a policy- and from the Policy Denylist subcategory- select the Domain and URL- and enable the newly created denylist for the IP of the network.
Is uploading data top the blacklisted network being denied now?

Hi Andre,

Thank you for your email.
1.So  <https://1.So> if I understand this correctly, the notification saying the element is blocked shows up and it should not?
I would check the Reports and Analysis Section- Content Aware reports- and see the triggered element.
Also, if the pop ups are annoying, you can simply disable them


2.I understand, I think the issue.So <https://issue.So> it applies the policy only for the first time of that file, but then if the file is changed/edited the policy is not applying anymore? I am not sure exactly how Nextcloud is operating.Is <https://operating.Is> encryption involved? Also is it inspecting the headers?
For instance, our DPI setting if active, it enables a proxy server, which scans for content. Now if other solutions, like other proxies,antivirus, firewalls, etc are scanning the traffic too, our DPI setting no longer scans it, so a quick question here. Is the DPI active?Do they use proxies, firewalls, etc, anything that could scan traffic?
If they do, and DPI was active, they might want to enable Stealthy DPI option from Global settings.

TextBody:
Hi Andre,

I do have some updates.

They managed to reproduce some similar behavior by copying a file containing SQL code when no policy was applied. The file was uploaded to the cloud, as expected.
Next, they enabled the policy with the same settings as presented in the video and recopied the same file (with the same name) to the synced location. This time, instead of being blocked, the file was uploaded. By copying a file (containing SQL code) with a different name or doing the steps presented in the video (copy-pasting SQL code to an empty file previously copied), it was blocked.


The only aspect that they would like to track now in order to get an idea on what happens is to see if the app somehow uses some cache locations, so that when a file that was previously allowed, would be also uploaded later (even when it should be blocked due to the SQL text copied to it) based on its name, and not on its hash.


In order to check if this is the case, please redo the test and try to change the name of the file in which you copy the SQL code before syncing to see if it still doesn't get blocked.

According to your result, they  will prepare a test build with some additional logs.


 For testing, they used Nextcloud version 3.13.2. What version are you testing with?

Adrian Stanca
Technical Support Engineer

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | Enforced Encryption | eDiscovery
Email | Website | LinkedIn

Hi Andre,

1.So  <https://1.So> if I understand this correctly, the notification saying the element is blocked shows up and it should not?
I would check the Reports and Analysis Section- Content Aware reports- and see the triggered element.
Also, if the pop ups are annoying, you can simply disable them


2.I understand, I think the issue.So <https://issue.So> it applies the policy only for the first time of that file, but then if the file is changed/edited the policy is not applying anymore? I am not sure exactly how Nextcloud is operating.Is <https://operating.Is> encryption involved? Also is it inspecting the headers?
For instance, our DPI setting if active, it enables a proxy server, which scans for content. Now if other solutions, like other proxies,antivirus, firewalls, etc are scanning the traffic too, our DPI setting no longer scans it, so a quick question here. Is the DPI active?Do they use proxies, firewalls, etc, anything that could scan traffic?
If they do, and DPI was active, they might want to enable Stealthy DPI option from Global settings.

Hi Andre,

I do have some updates.

They managed to reproduce some similar behavior by copying a file containing SQL code when no policy was applied. The file was uploaded to the cloud, as expected.
Next, they enabled the policy with the same settings as presented in the video and recopied the same file (with the same name) to the synced location. This time, instead of being blocked, the file was uploaded. By copying a file (containing SQL code) with a different name or doing the steps presented in the video (copy-pasting SQL code to an empty file previously copied), it was blocked.


The only aspect that they would like to track now in order to get an idea on what happens is to see if the app somehow uses some cache locations, so that when a file that was previously allowed, would be also uploaded later (even when it should be blocked due to the SQL text copied to it) based on its name, and not on its hash.


In order to check if this is the case, please redo the test and try to change the name of the file in which you copy the SQL code before syncing to see if it still doesn't get blocked.

According to your result, they  will prepare a test build with some additional logs.


 For testing, they used Nextcloud version 3.13.2. What version are you testing with?

Hi Andre,

I do have some updates.

They managed to reproduce some similar behavior by copying a file containing SQL code when no policy was applied. The file was uploaded to the cloud, as expected.
Next, they enabled the policy with the same settings as presented in the video and recopied the same file (with the same name) to the synced location. This time, instead of being blocked, the file was uploaded. By copying a file (containing SQL code) with a different name or doing the steps presented in the video (copy-pasting SQL code to an empty file previously copied), it was blocked.


The only aspect that they would like to track now in order to get an idea on what happens is to see if the app somehow uses some cache locations, so that when a file that was previously allowed, would be also uploaded later (even when it should be blocked due to the SQL text copied to it) based on its name, and not on its hash.


In order to check if this is the case, please redo the test and try to change the name of the file in which you copy the SQL code before syncing to see if it still doesn't get blocked.

According to your result, they will prepare a test build with some additional logs.


For testing, they used Nextcloud version 3.13.2. What version are you testing with?

Adrian Stanca

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BNgRj:ref

Hi Adrian

When I change the file name he blocks it and even delete the old file from the server. (without forced Sync)
But I realised something different.
The normal natural synchronisation from Nextcloud is stopped by Endpoint Protector and is not synced even an hour later.
Now when I use the forced synchronisation Nextcloud ignores Endpoint Protector and all code will be uploaded.
Even the file which I renamed before and was deleted.

Kind regards
Andre Tinnemann

Hi Andre,

I do have some updates.

They managed to reproduce some similar behavior by copying a file containing SQL code when no policy was applied. The file was uploaded to the cloud, as expected.
Next, they enabled the policy with the same settings as presented in the video and recopied the same file (with the same name) to the synced location. This time, instead of being blocked, the file was uploaded. By copying a file (containing SQL code) with a different name or doing the steps presented in the video (copy-pasting SQL code to an empty file previously copied), it was blocked.


The only aspect that they would like to track now in order to get an idea on what happens is to see if the app somehow uses some cache locations, so that when a file that was previously allowed, would be also uploaded later (even when it should be blocked due to the SQL text copied to it) based on its name, and not on its hash.


In order to check if this is the case, please redo the test and try to change the name of the file in which you copy the SQL code before syncing to see if it still doesn't get blocked.

According to your result, they will prepare a test build with some additional logs.


For testing, they used Nextcloud version 3.13.2. What version are you testing with?

Adrian Stanca

Hi Adrian

 

When I change the file name he blocks it and even delete the old file from the server. (without forced Sync)

But I realised something different.

The normal natural synchronisation from Nextcloud is stopped by Endpoint Protector and is not synced even an hour later.

Now when I use the forced synchronisation Nextcloud ignores Endpoint Protector and all code will be uploaded.

Even the file which I renamed before and was deleted.

Hi Andre,

I do have some updates.

They managed to reproduce some similar behavior by copying a file containing SQL code when no policy was applied. The file was uploaded to the cloud, as expected.
Next, they enabled the policy with the same settings as presented in the video and recopied the same file (with the same name) to the synced location. This time, instead of being blocked, the file was uploaded. By copying a file (containing SQL code) with a different name or doing the steps presented in the video (copy-pasting SQL code to an empty file previously copied), it was blocked.


The only aspect that they would like to track now in order to get an idea on what happens is to see if the app somehow uses some cache locations, so that when a file that was previously allowed, would be also uploaded later (even when it should be blocked due to the SQL text copied to it) based on its name, and not on its hash.


In order to check if this is the case, please redo the test and try to change the name of the file in which you copy the SQL code before syncing to see if it still doesn't get blocked.

According to your result, they will prepare a test build with some additional logs.


For testing, they used Nextcloud version 3.13.2. What version are you testing with?

Adrian Stanca
